bio:treatment.discussion: Sporophytes are very common in subsp. fimbriatum. It is associated with Sphagnum centrale, S. fallax, S. henryense, S. affine, S. palustre, S. russowii, S. teres, S. warnstorfii, and Drepanocladus exannulatus. It is normally very easily recognizable because of its very small size, pale green color, and distinct terminal bud. In Alaska it overlaps with subsp. concinnum, which has a similarly very broad and lacerate stem leaf apex but the lacerate margin does not extend down the sides of the leaf. Subspecies concinnum is also a more compact-growing taxon with a distinctly browner color.
